List all clusters scoped to API Key. import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ## Example ```shell export API_KEY="" curl --request GET \ --url "https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/clusters" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --header "accept: application/json" ``` Possible response is similar to the following ```json { "code": 0, "data": { "count": 1, "currentPage": 1, "pageSize": 10, "clusters": [ { "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "clusterName": "dedicated-3", "description": "", "regionId": "ali-cn-hangzhou", "plan": "Standard", "cuType": "Performance-optimized", "cuSize": 1, "status": "RUNNING", "connectAddress": "https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.ali-cn-hangzhou.vectordb.zillizcloud.com:19530", "privateLinkAddress": "", "createTime": "2024-06-30T16:49:50Z", "projectId": "proj-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" } ] } } ```

parameters.description: The number of records to include in each response.

200.description: Return a list of clusters in detail.

regionId.description: ID of the cloud region hosting the cluster.

cuType.description:
CU type of the cluster.
This applies to dedicated clusters only. For free and serverless clusters, the value is empty.

cuSize.description: CU size of the cluster. For free and serverless clusters, the value is always `0`.

projectId.description: ID of the project to which the cluster belongs.

createTime.description: Time at which the cluster has been created.

get.description:
Describe a cluster in detail. import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ## Example ```shell export API_KEY="" curl --request GET \ --url "https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/clusters/inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --header "accept: application/json" ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code":0, "data": { "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "clusterName": "Dedicated-01", "projectId": "proj-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "description": "", "regionId": "ali-cn-hangzhou", "cuType": "Performance-optimized", "plan": "Standard", "status": "RUNNING", "connectAddress": "https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.ali-cn-hangzhou.vectordb.zillizcloud.com:19530", "privateLinkAddress": "", "createTime": "2024-06-30T16:34:09Z", "cuSize": 2, "storageSize": 0, "snapshotNumber": 0, "createProgress": 100 } } ```

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: ID of the cluster whose details are to return.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization token. You should always use an API key with appropriate permissions.

200.description: Returns the details of a specified cluster.

projectId.description: ID of the project to which the cluster belongs.

regionId.description: ID of the cloud region hosting the cluster.

cuType.description:
CU type of the cluster.
This applies to dedicated clusters only. For free and serverless clusters, the value is empty.

cuSize.description: CU size of the cluster. For free and serverless clusters, the value is always `0`.

createTime.description: Time at which the cluster has been created.

post.description:
Retrieves the progress of a specified import job. import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ## Example ```shell export API_KEY="" curl --location --request POST "https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/vectordb/jobs/import/getProgress" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ --data-raw '{ "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "jobId": 44870776388440916 }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 0, "data": { "jobId": "448761313698322011", "collectionName": "medium_articles", "fileName":"medium_articles_2020_dpr.json", "fileSize": 3279917, "state": "Completed", "progress": 100, "completeTime": "2024-04-01T06:17:55Z", "reason":"", "totalRows": 100000, "details": [ { "fileName": "medium_articles_2020_dpr.json", "fileSize": 3279917, "state": "Completed", "progress": 100, "completeTime": "2024-04-01T06:17:53Z", "reason":"" } ] } } ```

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization token. You should always use an API key with appropriate permissions.

jobId.description: The ID of the import job in concern

clusterId.description: The ID of a cluster to which this operation applies.

200.description: Returns the progress of a specified import job.

collectionName.description: Target collection name of the import job.

fileName.description: Path of the data file object in the object storage.

fileSize.description: Size of the data file object.

state.description: State of this import job. Possible values are Pending, Importing, Completed, and Failed.

progress.description: Progress in percentage of the current import job.

completeTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the import job is complete.

reason.description: Reason for the failure to import data.

totalRows.description: Number of rows in the specified collection.

fileName.description: The name of a data file.

fileSize.description: The size of the data file.

state.description: The processing state of the data file. Possible values are Pending, Importing, Completed, and Failed.

completeTime.description: The timestamp at which the file is processed.

reason.description: The reason for the failure to import data.

details.description: Statistics on data import oriented to data files.

get.description:
Lists all available cloud regions. You may list only the applicable regions of a specific cloud provider. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export API_KEY="" export CLOUD_ID="" # List all available cloud regions. curl --request GET \ --url "https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/regions" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --header "accept: application/json" # List all available cloud regions of a specific provider. curl -i --request GET \ --url "https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/regions?cloudId=${CLOUD_ID}" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --header "accept: application/json" ``` Possible response is similar to the following ```json { "code": 0, "data": [ { "cloudId": "ali", "regionId": "ali-cn-hangzhou", "domain": "api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn" }, { "cloudId": "tc", "regionId": "tc-ap-beijing", "domain": "api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn" } ] } ```

parameters.name: cloudId
parameters.description: ID of a cloud provider. You can list applicable cloud providers using [List Cloud Providers](/reference/restful/list-cloud-providers-v2)

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization token. You should always use an API key with appropriate permissions.

200.description: Return a list of cloud regions in detail.

cloudId.description: ID of the cloud provider that provides the region.

domain.description: Base URL of the V2 API server at the control plane.

 ```shell export API_KEY="" export REGION_ID="" curl --request POST \ --url https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/clusters/createDedicated \ --header 'Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}' \ --header 'accept: application/json' \ --header 'content-type: application/json' \ --data-raw '{ "clusterName": "Cluster-05", "projectId": "proj-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "regionId": "${REGION_ID}", "plan": "Standard", "cuType": "Performance-optimized", "cuSize": 1 }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following ```json { code: 0, data: { "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "username":"db_admin", "password":"****************", "prompt": "Successfully submitted, cluster is being created. password.description: Password of the cluster administration user.
